member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.HighlightsAndShadowsEffect
member.summary: Adjusts the highlights and shadows of an image.

remarks.p: This Windows Runtime type corresponds to the D2D Highlights and shadows effect.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.HighlightsAndShadowsEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the HighlightsAndShadowsEffect class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.HighlightsAndShadowsEffect.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the input source for HighlightsAndShadows effect.
member.remarks: This property is initialized to null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.HighlightsAndShadowsEffect.SourceIsLinearGamma
member.summary: Specifies whether the source image uses linear gamma as opposed to the default sRGB.

remarks.p: This effect works in linear gamma space, so if the input image is already linear, SourceIsLinearGamma should be set to true to prevent sRGB to linear conversions being performed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.HighlightsAndShadowsEffect.Highlights
member.summary: How much to increase or decrease the brighter parts of the image. Default value 0, range -1 to 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.HighlightsAndShadowsEffect.Shadows
member.summary: How much to increase or decrease the darker parts of the image. Default value 0, range -1 to 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.HighlightsAndShadowsEffect.Clarity
member.summary: How much to increase or decrease the mid-tone contrast of the image. Default value 0, range -1 to 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.HighlightsAndShadowsEffect.MaskBlurAmount
member.summary: Controls the size of the region used around a pixel to classify it as highlight or shadow. Lower values result in more localized adjustments. Default value 1.25, range 0 to 10.
